Indeed, there are a lot of pathways into Product Management but actually getting in to the field is quite the hurdle. For all that read this that might not have formal PM experience or aren't on a PM track within their organization; I highly recommend blazing your own trail after the capstone, even as a side project to your current work, with your own product and documenting your process behind it using everything you learn in this specialization (and don't cut corners because of lack of resources!). It doesn't have to be grandiose in scale and if you feel you are lacking in certain skills, recruit a good friend or co-worker that just wants to do something fun and add to their portfolio to help you build. Most importantly, never give up in finding work as a PM working on a product you'd use frequently and is meaningful to you! To your question, Katerina-- biggest challenge as a Product Manager... I'd say for me it has been influencing a change in organizational ways of thinking which really boils down to building group consensus on what tools and methodologies to use, and, most importantly actually carrying out what you're supposed to do with them!
